experiment.probStim module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
class experiment.probStim.Probstim(cues=None, actualities=None, trialsteps=100, numStimuli=4, correctProb=0.8, correctProbabilities=None, rewardlessT=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: experiment.experimentTemplate.Experiment

Basic probabilistic

Many methods are inherited from the experiment.experiment.experiment class. Refer to its documentation for missing methods.

Name¶

The name of the class used when recording what has been used.

Type:string
Parameters:
  • actualities (int, optional) – The actual reality the cues pointed to. The correct response the participant is trying to get correct
  • cues (array of floats, optional) – The cues used to guess the actualities
  • trialsteps (int, optional) – If no provided cues, it is the number of trialsteps for the generated set of cues. Default 100
  • numStimuli (int, optional) – If no provided cues, it is the number of distinct stimuli for the generated set of cues. Default 4
  • correctProb (float in [0,1], optional) – If no actualities provided, it is the probability of the correct answer being answer 1 rather than answer 0. The default is 0.8
  • correctProbs (list or array of floats in [0,1], optional) – If no actualities provided, it is the probability of the correct answer being answer 1 rather than answer 0 for each of the different stimuli. Default [corrProb, 1-corrProb] * (numStimuli//2) + [corrProb] * (numStimuli%2)
  • rewardlessT (int, optional) – If no actualities provided, it is the number of actualities at the end of the experiment that will have a None reward. Default 2*numStimuli
feedback()[source]¶

Feedback to the action from the participant

next()[source]¶

Produces the next stimulus for the iterator

Returns:
  • stimulus (Tuple) – The current cues
  • nextValidActions (Tuple of ints or None) – The list of valid actions that the model can respond with. Set to (0,1), as they never vary.
Raises:StopIteration
proceed()[source]¶

Updates the experiment after feedback

receiveAction(action)[source]¶

Receives the next action from the participant

Parameters:action (int or string) – The action taken by the model
returnTaskState()[source]¶

Returns all the relevant data for this experiment run

Returns:results – A dictionary containing the class parameters as well as the other useful data
Return type:dictionary
storeState()[source]¶

Stores the state of all the important variables so that they can be output later

experiment.probStim.probrewDiff()[source]¶

Processes the reward for models expecting reward corrections

Returns:probrew – The function expects to be passed a tuple containing the reward the last action and the last stimuli. The function returns the reward.
Return type:function
experiment.probStim.Name¶

The identifier of the function

Type:string

See also

model.QLearn(), model.QLearn2(), model.decision.binary.eta()

experiment.probStim.probrewDualCorrection(epsilon)[source]¶

Processes the reward for models expecting the reward correction from two possible actions.

Returns:deckRew – The function expects to be passed a tuple containing the reward the last action and the last stimuli. The reward that is a float and action is {0,1}. The function returns a list of length 2.
Return type:function
experiment.probStim.Name

The identifier of the function

Type:string

See also

model.BP(), model.EP(), model.MS(), model.MSRev()

experiment.probStim.probstimDirect()[source]¶

Processes the stimuli for models expecting just the event

Returns:probstim – The function expects to be passed a tuple containing the event and the last action. The function returns the event
Return type:function
